event.name: Retired SSE/AVX FLOPs

mask.description: MacFLOPs count as 2 FLOPs. Does not provide a useful count without use of the MergeEvent feature.
Divide/square root FLOPs Does not provide a useful count without use of the MergeEvent feature.
Multiply FLOPs Does not provide a useful count without use of the MergeEvent feature.
Add/subtract FLOPs Does not provide a useful count without use of the MergeEvent feature.

predefined.description: The number of retired SSE/AVX flops. The number of events logged per cycle can vary from 0 to 64. This is large increment per cycle predefined, since it can count more than 15 events per cycle. This counts both single precision and double precision FP events.

event.description: This is a retire-based event. The number of retired SSE/AVX FLOPs. The number of events logged per cycle can vary from 0 to 64. This event is a MergeEvent since it can count above 15 events per cycle.

event.name: Retired Serializing Ops

mask.description: SSE bottom-executing uOps retired
SSE control word mispredict traps due to mispredictions in RC, FTZ or DAZ, or changes in mask bits
x87 bottom-executing uOps retired
x87 control word mispredict traps due to mispredictions in RC or PC, or changes in mask bits

event.description: The number of serializing Ops retired.

event.name: FP Dispatch Faults

mask.description: YMM Spill fault
YMM Fill fault
XMM Fill fault
x87 Fill fault

event.description: Floating Point Dispatch Faults.

mask.description: Store-to-load conflicts: A load was unable to complete due to a non-forwardable conflict with an older store. Most commonly, a load's address range partially but not completely overlaps with an uncompleted older store. Software can avoid this problem by using same-size and same-alignment loads and stores when accessing the same data. Vector/SIMD code is particularly susceptible to this problem; software should construct wide vector stores by manipulating vector elements in registers using shuffle/blend/swap instructions prior to storing to memory, instead of using narrow element-by-element stores.

event.name: Retired Lock Instructions
event.description: Unit Mask 0x0E represents cacheable locks.

event.name: Retired CLFLUSH Instructions
event.description: The number of retired CLFLUSH instructions. This is a non-speculative event.

event.name: Retired CPUID Instructions
event.description: The number of CPUID instructions retired.

event.name: LS Dispatch

mask.description: Load-op-Store Dispatch Dispatch of a single op that performs a load from and store to the same memory address.
Dispatch of a single op that performs a memory store.
Dispatch of a single op that performs a memory load.

predefined.description: The number of load and store ops dispatched to LS unit. This counts the dispatch of single op that performs a memory load, dispatch of single op that performs a memory store, dispatch of a single op that performs a load from and store to the same memory address.

event.description: Counts the number of operations dispatched to the LS unit. Unit Masks ADDed.

event.name: SMIs Received
event.description: Counts the number of SMIs received.

event.name: Interrupts Taken
event.description: Counts the number of interrupts taken.

event.name: Store to Load Forward
event.description: Number of STLF hits.

mask.description: A non-cacheable store and the non-cacheable commit buffer is full.

event.name: Data Cache Refills from System

mask.description: From DRAM (home node remote).
From another cache (home node remote).
From DRAM (home node local).
From another cache (home node local).
From local L2 hit.

predefined.description: Counts all L2 Prefetches accepted by L2 pipeline which hit in the L2 Cache.
The demand Data Cache (DC) fills from same the cache of same CCX or cache of different CCX in the same package (node).
The demand Data Cache (DC) fills from cache of CCX in the different package (node).
The demand Data Cache (DC) fills from DRAM or IO connected in the same package (node).
The demand Data Cache (DC) fills from DRAM or IO connected in the different package (node).
The demand Data Cache (DC) fills from all data sources.

event.description: Demand Data Cache Fills by Data Source.

mask.description: DTLB reload to a 1G page that also miss in the L2 TLB.
DTLB reload to a 2M page that also miss in the L2 TLB.
DTLB reload to a 4K page that miss the L2 TLB.
DTLB reload to a 1G page that hit in the L2 TLB.
DTLB reload to a 2M page that hit in the L2 TLB.
DTLB reload to a 4K page that hit in the L2 TLB.

predefined.description: The L1 Data Translation Lookaside Buffer (DTLB) Misses from load store micro-ops. This predefined counts both L2-DTLB hit and L2-DTLB Miss.
The L2 Data Translation Lookaside Buffer (DTLB) Missed from load store micro-ops.
The number of misaligned loads. On Zen3, this predefined counts the 64B (cacheline crossing) and 4K (page crossing) misaligned loads.

event.name: Prefetch Instructions Dispatched

mask.description: PrefetchNTA instruction.
PrefetchW instruction.
Prefetch_T0_T1_T2 PrefetchT0, T1 and T2 instructions.

event.description: Software Prefetch Instructions Dispatched (Speculative).

event.name: Ineffective Software Prefetches

mask.description: Software PREFETCH instruction saw a match on an already-allocated miss request buffer.
Software PREFETCH instruction saw a DC hit.

predefined.description: The number of software prefetches that did not fetch data outside of the processor core. This predefined counts the Software PREFETCH instruction that saw a match on an already - allocated miss request buffer.Also counts the Software PREFETCH instruction that saw a DC hit.

event.description: The number of software prefetches that did not fetch data outside of the processor core.

event.name: Software Prefetch Data Cache Fills

mask.description: From DRAM (home node remote).
From another cache (home node remote).
From DRAM (home node local).
From another cache (home node local).
From local L2 hit.

event.description: Software Prefetch Data Cache Fills by Data Source.

event.name: Hardware Prefetch Data Cache Fills

mask.description: From DRAM (home node remote).
From another cache (home node remote).
From DRAM (home node local).
From another cache (home node local).
From local L2 hit.

event.description: Hardware Prefetch Data Cache Fills by Data Source.

event.name: Count of Allocated Mabs
event.description: This event counts the in-flight L1 data cache misses each cycle. This event is a MergeEvent since it can count above 15 events per cycle.

predefined.description: The number of cpu cycles when the thread is not in halt state.

event.name: Instruction Cache Refills from L2
event.description: The number of 64-byte instruction cache line was fulfilled from the L2 cache.

event.name: Instruction Cache Refills from System
event.description: The number of 64-byte instruction cache line fulfilled from system memory or another cache.

event.name: L1 ITLB Miss, L2 ITLB Hit

predefined.description: The instruction fetches that Misses in the L1 Instruction Translation Lookaside Buffer (ITLB) but hit in the L2-ITLB.

event.description: The number of instruction fetches that miss in the L1 ITLB but hit in the L2 ITLB.

event.name: L1 ITLB Miss, L2 ITLB Miss

mask.description: Instruction fetches to a 1 GB page
Instruction fetches to a 2 MB page
Instruction fetches to a 4 KB page

predefined.description: The ITLB reloads originating from page table walker. The table walk requests are made for L1-ITLB Miss and L2-ITLB Misses.

event.description: The number of instruction fetches that miss in both the L1 and L2 TLBs.

event.name: L1 Branch Prediction Overrides Existing Prediction (speculative)
L2 Branch Prediction Overrides Existing Prediction (speculative)
Dynamic Indirect Predictions
event.description: Indirect Branch Prediction for potential multi-target branch (speculative).

event.name: ITLB Instruction Fetch Hits

mask.description: L1 Instruction TLB hit (1G page size).
L1 Instruction TLB hit (2M page size).
L1 Instruction TLB hit (4K page size).

event.description: The number of instruction fetches that hit in the L1 ITLB.

event.name: Micro-Op Queue Empty
event.description: Cycles where the Micro-Op Queue is empty.

event.name: UOps Dispatched From Decoder

mask.description: Count of dispatched Ops from OpCache
Count of dispatched Ops from Decoder

event.description: Ops dispatched from either the decoders, OpCache or both.

event.name: Dispatch Resource Stall Cycles 1

mask.description: FP Miscellaneous resource unavailable Applies to the recovery of mispredicts with FP ops.
FP scheduler resource stall Applies to ops that use the FP scheduler.
floating point register file resource stall Applies to all FP ops that have a destination register.
taken branch buffer resource stall
Integer Scheduler miscellaneous resource stall
Store Queue resource stall Applies to all ops with store semantics.
Load Queue resource stall Applies to all ops with load semantics.
Integer Physical Register File resource stall Integer Physical Register File, applies to all ops that have an integer destination register.

event.description: Cycles where a dispatch group is valid but does not get dispatched due to a Token Stall.

event.name: Dispatch Resource Stall Cycles 0

mask.description: ALU tokens total unavailable

event.description: Cycles where a dispatch group is valid but does not get dispatched due to a token stall.

predefined.description: The number of instructions retired from execution. This count includes exceptions and interrupts. Each exception or interrupt is counted as one instruction.

event.name: Retired Uops

predefined.description: The number of macro-ops retired. This count includes all processor activity - instructions, exceptions, interrupts, microcode assists, etc.

event.description: The number of micro-ops retired. This count includes all processor activity (instructions, exceptions, interrupts, microcode assists, etc.). The number of events logged per cycle can vary from 0 to 8.

event.name: Retired Branch Instructions

predefined.description: The number of branch instructions retired. This includes all types of architectural control flow changes, including exceptions and interrupts.

event.description: The number of branch instructions retired. This includes all types of architectural control flow changes, including exceptions and interrupts.

event.name: Retired Branch Instructions Mispredicted

predefined.description: The number of retired branch instructions, that were mispredicted.Note that only EX direct mispredicts and indirect target mispredicts are counted

event.description: The number of branch instructions retired, of any type, that were not correctly predicted. This includes those for which prediction is not attempted (far control transfers, exceptions and interrupts).

event.name: Retired Taken Branch Instructions
event.description: The number of taken branches that were retired. This includes all types of architectural control flow changes, including exceptions and interrupts.

event.name: Retired Taken Branch Instructions Mispredicted
event.description: The number of retired taken branch instructions that were mispredicted.

event.name: Retired Far Control Transfers
event.description: The number of far control transfers retired including far call/jump/return, IRET, SYSCALL and SYSRET, plus exceptions and interrupts. Far control transfers are not subject to branch prediction.

event.name: Retired Near Returns
event.description: The number of near return instructions (RET or RET Iw) retired.

event.name: Retired Near Returns Mispredicted
event.description: The number of near returns retired that were not correctly predicted by the return address predictor. Each such mispredict incurs the same penalty as a mispredicted conditional branch instruction.

event.name: Retired Indirect Branch Instructions Mispredicted
event.description: The number of indirect branches retired that were not correctly predicted. Each such mispredict incurs the same penalty as a mispredicted conditional branch instruction. Note that only EX mispredicts are counted.

event.name: Retired MMX/FP Instructions

mask.description: SSE instructions (SSE, SSE2, SSE3, SSSE3, SSE4A, SSE41, SSE42, AVX).
MMX instructions.
x87 instructions

event.description: The number of MMX, SSE or x87 instructions retired. The UnitMask allows the selection of the individual classes of instructions as given in the table. Each increment represents one complete instruction. Since this event includes non-numeric instructions it is not suitable for measuring MFLOPs.

event.name: Retired Mispredicted Branch Instructions due to Direction Mismatch
event.description: The number of retired conditional branch instructions that were not correctly predicted because of a branch direction mismatch.

mask.description: Number of times an op could not be tagged by IBS because of a previous tagged op that has not retired.
Number of Ops tagged by IBS that retired
Number of Ops tagged by IBS

event.name: Retired Fused Instructions
event.description: The number of fuse-branch instructions retired per cycle. The number of events logged per cycle can vary from 0-8.

event.name: Requests to L2 Group1

mask.description: Data Cache Reads (including hardware and software prefetch).
Data Cache Stores.
Data Cache Shared Reads.
Instruction Cache Reads.
Data Cache State Change Requests Request change to writable, check L2 for current state.
L2 Prefetcher All prefetches accepted by L2 pipeline, hit or miss. Types of PF and L2 hit/miss broken out in a separate perfmon event.
Miscellaneous events covered in more detail by Core::X86::Pmc::Core::L2RequestG2 (PMCx061).

predefined.description: The L2 cache access requests due to L1 instruction cache misses.
The L2 cache access requests due to L1 data cache misses. This also counts hardware and software prefetches.
All L2 cache requests.

event.description: All L2 Cache Requests (Breakdown 1 - Common).

event.name: Requests to L2 Group2

mask.description: Miscellaneous events covered in more detail by Core::X86::Pmc::Core::L2RequestG1 (PMCx060).
Data cache Read sized.
Data cache Read sized non-cacheable.
Instruction cache Read sized.
Instruction cache Read sized non-cacheable.
Self-modifying code invalidates.
Bus locks
Bus Lock Response.

event.description: All L2 Cache Requests (Breakdown 2 - Rare).

event.name: Core to L2 Cacheable Request Access Status

mask.description: Data Cache Shared Read Hit in L2
Data Cache Read Hit in L2
Data Cache Read Hit on Shared Line in L2
Data Cache Store or State Change Hit in L2
Data Cache Req Miss in L2 (all types)
Instruction Cache Hit Modifiable Line in L2
Instruction Cache Hit Clean Line in L2
Instruction Cache Req Miss in L2

predefined.description: Count all the Instruction cache fill requests that misses in L2 cache.
Count all L1 Instruction Cache 32B Fetch Misses.
Count all the L2 Cache Misses that Misses in L1 Data Cache Miss.
Counts all the Instruction cache fill requests that hits in L2 cache.
Counts all the Data cache fill request that hits in L2 cache.

event.description: L2 Cache Request Outcomes (not including L2 Prefetch).

event.name: L2 Prefetch Hit in L2

subEventValue.description: Requires unit mask 0xFF to engage event for counting.

predefined.description: The demand Data Cache (DC) fills from local L2 cache to the core.

event.description: Requires unit mask 0xFF to engage event for counting.

event.name: L2 Prefetcher Hits in L3

predefined.description: Counts all L2 Prefetches accepted by the L2 pipeline which Miss the L2 Cache and hit the L3.

event.description: Requires unit mask 0xFF to engage event for counting. Counts all L2 prefetches accepted by the L2 pipeline which miss the L2 cache and hit the L3.

event.name: L2 Prefetcher Misses in L3

predefined.description: Counts all L2 Prefetches accepted by the L2 pipeline which Miss the L2 and the L3 Caches.

event.description: Requires unit mask 0xFF to engage event for counting. Counts all L2 prefetches accepted by the L2 pipeline which miss the L2 and the L3 caches.

event.name: L3 Cache Miss Latency
event.description: Ignores SliceMask and ThreadMask. Total cycles for all transactions divided by 16.

event.name: L3 Misses by Request Type
event.description: Ignores SliceMask and ThreadMask. Requires unit mask 0xFF to engage event for counting.

event.name: All IBS fetch samples
event.description: The number of all IBS fetch samples. This derived event counts the number of all IBS fetch samples that were collected including IBS-killed fetch samples.

event.name: IBS fetch killed
event.description: The number of IBS sampled fetches that were killed fetches. A fetch operation is killed if the fetch did not reach ITLB or IC access. The number of killed fetch samples is not generally useful for analysis and are filtered out in other derived IBS fetch events (except Event Select 0xF000 which counts all IBS fetch samples including IBS killed fetch samples.)

event.name: IBS fetch attempted
event.description: The number of IBS sampled fetches that were not killed fetch attempts. This derived event measures the number of useful fetch attempts and does not include the number of IBS killed fetch samples. This event should be used to compute ratios such as the ratio of IBS fetch IC misses to attempted fetches. The number of attempted fetches should equal the sum of the number of completed fetches and the number of aborted fetches.

event.name: IBS fetch completed
event.description: The number of IBS sampled fetches that completed. A fetch is completed if the attempted fetch delivers instruction data to the instruction decoder. Although the instruction data was delivered, it may still not be used (e.g., the instruction data may have been on the "wrong path" of an incorrectly predicted branch.)

event.name: IBS fetch aborted
event.description: The number of IBS sampled fetches that aborted. An attempted fetch is aborted if it did not complete and deliver instruction data to the decoder. An attempted fetch may abort at any point in the process of fetching instruction data. An abort may be due to a branch redirection as the result of a mispredicted branch. The number of IBS aborted fetch samples is a lower bound on the amount of unsuccessful, speculative fetch activity. It is a lower bound since the instruction data delivered by completed fetches may not be used.

event.name: IBS ITLB hit
event.description: The number of IBS attempted fetch samples where the fetch operation initially hit in the L1 ITLB (Instruction Translation Lookaside Buffer).

event.name: IBS L1 ITLB misses (and L2 ITLB hits)
event.description: The number of IBS attempted fetch samples where the fetch operation initially missed in the L1 ITLB and hit in the L2 ITLB.

event.name: IBS L1 L2 ITLB miss
event.description: The number of IBS attempted fetch samples where the fetch operation initially missed in both the L1 ITLB and the L2 ITLB.

event.name: IBS instruction cache misses
event.description: The number of IBS attempted fetch samples where the fetch operation initially missed in the IC (instruction cache).

event.name: IBS instruction cache hit
event.description: The number of IBS attempted fetch samples where the fetch operation initially hit in the IC.

event.name: IBS 4K page translation
event.description: The number of IBS attempted fetch samples where the fetch operation produced a valid physical address (i.e., address translation completed successfully) and used a 4-KByte page entry in the L1 ITLB.

event.name: IBS 2M page translation
event.description: The number of IBS attempted fetch samples where the fetch operation produced a valid physical address (i.e., address translation completed successfully) and used a 2-MByte page entry in the L1 ITLB.

event.name: IBS 1G page translation
event.description: The number of IBS attempted fetch samples where the fetch operation produced a valid physical address (i.e., address translation completed successfully) and used a 1-GByte page entry in the L1 ITLB.

event.name: IBS fetch latency
event.description: The total latency of all IBS attempted fetch samples. Divide the total IBS fetch latency by the number of IBS attempted fetch samples to obtain the average latency of the attempted fetches that were sampled.

event.name: IBS fetch L2 cache miss
event.description: The instruction fetch missed in the L2 Cache.

event.name: IBS ITLB refill latency
event.description: The number of cycles when the fetch engine is stalled for an ITLB reload for the sampled fetch. If there is no reload, the latency will be 0.

event.name: All IBS op samples
event.description: The number of all IBS op samples that were collected. These op samples may be branch ops, resync ops, ops that perform load/store operations, or undifferentiated ops (e.g., those ops that perform arithmetic operations, logical operations, etc.). IBS collects data for retired ops. No data is collected for ops that are aborted due to pipeline flushes, etc. Thus, all sampled ops are architecturally significant and contribute to the successful forward progress of executing programs.

event.name: IBS tag-to-retire cycles
event.description: The total number of tag-to-retire cycles across all IBS op samples. The tag-to-retire time of an op is the number of cycles from when the op was tagged (selected for sampling) to when the op retired.

event.name: IBS completion-to-retire cycles
event.description: The total number of completion-to-retire cycles across all IBS op samples. The completion-to-retire time of an op is the number of cycles from when the op completed to when the op retired.

event.name: IBS branch op
event.description: The number of IBS retired branch op samples. A branch operation is a change in program control flow and includes unconditional and conditional branches, subroutine calls and subroutine returns. Branch ops are used to implement AMD64 branch semantics.

event.name: IBS mispredicted branch op
event.description: The number of IBS samples for retired branch operations that were mispredicted. This event should be used to compute the ratio of mispredicted branch operations to all branch operations.

event.name: IBS taken branch op
event.description: The number of IBS samples for retired branch operations that were taken branches.

event.name: IBS mispredicted taken branch op
event.description: The number of IBS samples for retired branch operations that were mispredicted taken branches.

event.name: IBS return op
event.description: The number of IBS retired branch op samples where the operation was a subroutine return. These samples are a subset of all IBS retired branch op samples.

event.name: IBS mispredicted return op
event.description: The number of IBS retired branch op samples where the operation was a mispredicted subroutine return. This event should be used to compute the ratio of mispredicted returns to all subroutine returns.

event.name: IBS resync op
event.description: The number of IBS resync op samples. A resync op is only found in certain microcoded AMD64 instructions and causes a complete pipeline flush.

event.name: IBS all load store ops
event.description: The number of IBS op samples for ops that perform either a load and/or store operation. An AMD64 instruction may be translated into one ("single fastpath"), two ("double fastpath"), or several ("vector path") ops. Each op may perform a load operation, a store operation or both a load and store operation (each to the same address). Some op samples attributed to an AMD64 instruction may perform a load/store operation while other op samples attributed to the same instruction may not. Further, some branch instructions perform load/store operations. Thus, a mix of op sample types may be attributed to a single AMD64 instruction depending upon the ops that are issued from the AMD64 instruction and the op types.

event.name: IBS load ops
event.description: The number of IBS op samples for ops that perform a load operation.

event.name: IBS store ops
event.description: The number of IBS op samples for ops that perform a store operation.

event.name: IBS L1 DTLB hit
event.description: The number of IBS op samples where either a load or store operation initially hit in the L1 DTLB (data translation lookaside buffer).

event.name: IBS L1 DTLB misses L2 hits
event.description: The number of IBS op samples where either a load or store operation initially missed in the L1 DTLB and hit in the L2 DTLB.

event.name: IBS L1 and L2 DTLB misses
event.description: The number of IBS op samples where either a load or store operation initially missed in both the L1 DTLB and the L2 DTLB.

event.name: IBS data cache misses
event.description: The number of IBS op samples where either a load or store operation initially missed in the data cache (DC).

event.name: IBS data cache hits
event.description: The number of IBS op samples where either a load or store operation initially hit in the data cache (DC).

event.name: IBS misaligned data access
event.description: The number of IBS op samples where either a load or store operation caused a misaligned access (i.e., the load or store operation crossed a 128-bit boundary).

event.name: IBS bank conflict on load op
event.description: The number of IBS op samples where either a load or store operation caused a bank conflict with a load operation.

event.name: IBS bank conflict on store op
event.description: The number of IBS op samples where either a load or store operation caused a bank conflict with a store operation.

event.name: IBS store-to-load forwarded
event.description: The number of IBS op samples where data for a load operation was forwarded from a store operation.

event.name: IBS store-to-load cancelled
event.description: The number of IBS op samples where data forwarding to a load operation from a store was cancelled.

event.name: IBS UC memory access
event.description: The number of IBS op samples where a load or store operation accessed uncacheable (UC) memory.

event.name: IBS WC memory access
event.description: The number of IBS op samples where a load or store operation accessed write combining (WC) memory.

event.name: IBS locked operation
event.description: The number of IBS op samples where a load or store operation was a locked operation.

event.name: IBS MAB hit
event.description: The number of IBS op samples where a load or store operation hit an already allocated entry in the Miss Address Buffer (MAB).

event.name: IBS L1 DTLB 4K page
event.description: The number of IBS op samples where a load or store operation produced a valid linear (virtual) address and a 4-KByte page entry in the L1 DTLB was used for address translation.

event.name: IBS L1 DTLB 2M page
event.description: The number of IBS op samples where a load or store operation produced a valid linear (virtual) address and a 2-MByte page entry in the L1 DTLB was used for address translation.

event.name: IBS L1 DTLB 1G page
event.description: The number of IBS op samples where a load or store operation produced a valid linear (virtual) address and a 1-GByte page entry in the L1 DTLB was used for address translation.

event.name: IBS L2 DTLB 4K page
event.description: The number of IBS op samples where a load or store operation produced a valid linear (virtual) address, hit the L2 DTLB, and used a 4 KByte page entry for address translation.

event.name: IBS L2 DTLB 2M page
event.description: The number of IBS op samples where a load or store operation produced a valid linear (virtual) address, hit the L2 DTLB, and used a 2-MByte page entry for address translation.

event.name: IBS L2 DTLB 1G page
event.description: The number of IBS op samples where a load or store operation produced a valid linear (virtual) address, hit the L2 DTLB, and used a 1-GByte page entry for address translation.

event.name: IBS data cache miss load latency
event.description: The total DC miss load latency (in processor cycles) across all IBS op samples that performed a load operation and missed in the data cache. The miss latency is the number of clock cycles from when the data cache miss was detected to when data was delivered to the core. Divide the total DC miss load latency by the number of data cache misses to obtain the average DC miss load latency.

event.name: IBS load resync
event.description: Load Resync.

event.name: IBS load DC/L2 Hit
event.description: The number of IBS op samples where a load operation hit in data cache or L2 cache.

event.name: IBS store DC Miss
event.description: The number of IBS op samples where a store operation missed in data cache.

event.name: IBS store DC Hit
event.description: The number of IBS op samples where a store operation hit in data cache.

event.name: IBS load DC Hit
event.description: The number of IBS op samples where a load operation hit in data cache.

event.name: IBS load DC Miss
event.description: The number of IBS op samples where a load operation missed in data cache.

event.name: IBS load L2 Hit
event.description: The number of IBS op samples where a load operation hit in L2 cache.

event.name: IBS load L2 Miss
event.description: The number of IBS op samples where a load operation missed in L2 Cache.

event.name: IBS load L2 Hit latency
event.description: The total dc miss load latency (in processor cycles) for the load operation that were serviced by the L2 cache.

event.name: IBS Northbridge local
event.description: The number of IBS op samples where a load operation was serviced from the local processor. Northbridge IBS data is only valid for load operations that miss in both the L1 data cache and the L2 data cache. If a load operation crosses a cache line boundary, then the IBS data reflects the access to the lower cache line.

event.name: IBS Northbridge remote
event.description: The number of IBS op samples where a load operation was serviced from a remote processor.

event.name: IBS Northbridge local L3
event.description: The number of IBS op samples where a load operation was serviced by the local L3 cache.

event.name: IBS Northbridge local core L1 or L2 cache
event.description: The number of IBS op samples where a load operation was serviced by a cache (L1 data cache or L2 cache) belonging to a local core which is a sibling of the core making the memory request.

event.name: IBS Northbridge local core L1, L2, L3 cache
event.description: The number of IBS op samples where a load operation was serviced by a remote L1 data cache, L2 cache or L3 cache after traversing one or more coherent HyperTransport links.

event.name: IBS Northbridge local DRAM
event.description: The number of IBS op samples where a load operation was serviced by local system memory (local DRAM via the memory controller).

event.name: IBS Northbridge remote DRAM
event.description: The number of IBS op samples where a load operation was serviced by remote system memory (after traversing one or more coherent HyperTransport links and through a remote memory controller).

event.name: IBS Northbridge local APIC MMIO Config PCI
event.description: The number of IBS op samples where a load operation was serviced from local MMIO, configuration or PCI space, or from the local APIC.

event.name: IBS Northbridge remote APIC MMIO Config PCI
event.description: The number of IBS op samples where a load operation was serviced from remote MMIO, configuration or PCI space.

event.name: IBS Northbridge cache modified state
event.description: The number of IBS op samples where a load operation was serviced from local or remote cache, and the cache hit state was the Modified (M) state.

event.name: IBS Northbridge cache owned state
event.description: The number of IBS op samples where a load operation was serviced from local or remote cache, and the cache hit state was the Owned (O) state.

event.name: IBS Northbridge local cache latency
event.description: The total data cache miss latency (in processor cycles) for load operations that were serviced by the local processor.

event.name: IBS Northbridge remote cache latency
event.description: The total data cache miss latency (in processor cycles) for load operations that were serviced by a remote processor.

event.name: IBS Northbridge local cache modified state
event.description: The number of IBS op samples where a load operation was serviced from local cache, and the cache hit state was the Modified (M) state.

event.name: IBS Northbridge remote cache modified state
event.description: The number of IBS op samples where a load operation was serviced from remote cache, and the cache hit state was the Modified (M) state.

event.name: IBS Northbridge local cache owned state
event.description: The number of IBS op samples where a load operation was serviced from local cache, and the cache hit state was the Owned (O) state.

event.name: IBS Northbridge remote cache owned state
event.description: The number of IBS op samples where a load operation was serviced from remote cache, and the cache hit state was the Owned (O) state.

event.name: IBS Northbridge local cache miss
event.description: The number of IBS op samples where a load operation missed in local cache, and was serviced from remote cache/DRAM/Other sources.

event.name: IBS Northbridge local cache hit latency
event.abbrev: IBS NB local cache hit latency
event.description: The total data cache miss latency (in processor cycles) for load operations that were serviced by the local cache.

event.name: IBS Northbridge remote cache hit latency
event.abbrev: IBS NB remote cache hit latency
event.description: The total data cache miss latency (in processor cycles) for load operations that were serviced by the remote cache.

event.name: IBS Northbridge local DRAM hit latency
event.abbrev: IBS NB local dram hit latency
event.description: The total data cache miss latency (in processor cycles) for load operations that were serviced by the local dram.

event.name: IBS Northbridge remote DRAM hit latency
event.abbrev: IBS NB remote dram hit latency
event.description: The total data cache miss latency (in processor cycles) for load operations that were serviced by the remote dram.

event.name: Energy
event.description: Energy Consumption.
